intro: Tecoma doratoxylon, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
